    level="1"
    right="Item 3"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Gaffe Glasses](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2380)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 191 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn eyepiece

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These wire-rim glasses appear to be [_glasses of sociability_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1057), making you think they grant a +1 item bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) when they grant none. The GM secretly adjusts your Diplomacy checks to ignore the bonus, and if you have multiple +1 item bonuses to Diplomacy, the glasses take precedence, negating those bonuses.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))    **Effect** Like _glasses of sociability_, with the same limitations, you stare at another creature. If you've met and exchanged names, you expect to instantly remember the target's name. However, you recall the worst possible incorrect name, such as mistaking a famous artist for their hated rival. This blunder doesn't prevent you from realizing the creature's real name after you've been corrected. Once you use this activation, the glasses fuse to you.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Gaffe Glasses
